column4: been googling this one for a while :  XORG_MANPAGE_SECTIONS: command not found
says my aclocal is not define but it is
its not a command, its a variable
i know that
so thats the problem ?
when do you get that
what are you building
then you shoujld know the basics of software development and required variables
was there a point to asking me questions
there was a point to me response - but if you don't know anything about what your doing - its dangerous
before you build software it is helpful to know the basics
its clear you don't
XORG_MAN_PAGES - hmmm what could it want
it's the m4 functions to build it wants
are you sure they are m4's its looking for and not just variables to be extracted from another global m4 script
what makes you strongly sure its M4 (not challanging - asking)
I think its wrong
FYI: the way its testing for those variables in the configure script is nothing to do with M4
why would it be a version thing ?
look at how the configured script is testing for the variable - it gives a big clue
you do know there is #ubuntu-xgl that specialises in ubuntu on xgl
just FYI
